page.title: 17Transport around Bawtry
page.content: Bawtry has seen several changes in the modes of transport in the area. Post coaches once stopped at the Crown Hotel and at one time there was a thriving river port on the River Idle, as is indicated by the name of Wharf Street. Since those days the river has changed its course and is not now navigable by large boats. The main east coast railway line passes closeby the town but the station is now closed. Thus the people are dependant on private cars or buses. There are 5 bus services linking Bawtry to the surrounding villages in both S. Yorks and Nottinghamshire and also Sheffield and Doncaster. Bus fares within South Yorkshire are heavily subsidised and a journey of 8 miles to Doncaster costs 15pence while to travel 3 miles to Scrooby,a village in Nottinghamshire, costs 35pence.
